intro: Declieuxia leiophylla, commonly known as the smooth-leafed grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and narrow, flat leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Declieuxia leiophylla is typically found in grasslands and rocky areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and forage for local wildlife.
